persons.name: Adrian John Williams
persons.summary:
Mr Williams has been an MP since 2009 having served as a Member of the Portfolio Committee on Public Service and Administration as well as the Portfolio Committee on Co-Operative Governance and Traditional Affairs. He joined the ANC, SACP and Chemical Workers Industrial Union in 1990 where he served as the ANC Secunda branch treasurer (1991-1992). Mr Williams was also active in the Yeoville branch of the ANC and SACP Structures (1993-1997). He has served as the SACP Secunda branch Secretary (1998), ANC Secunda Branch Secretary (1999), as a Mpumalanga additional PEC member (1999-2001), as Mpumalanga SACP Provincial Treasurer (2002-2005), a SAMWU Full-time Shop-steward (Govan Mbeki Local Municipality) and as the SACP Mpumalanga Provincial deputy Secretary (2006-to-date). (Source: anc.org.za)

He was sworn into the Fifth Parliament as an ANC MP on 27 November 2014.

Adrian John Williams's plenary attendance record for Feb-Apr [2013](/file_archive/Adrian-John-Williams-Attendance-2013 "Adrian John Williams") and [2012](/file_archive/Adrian-John-Williams-Attendance-2012 "Adrian John Williams").

persons.name: Ahmed Munzoor Shaik Emam
persons.summary:
Mr Shaik-Emam was a member of ACTSTOP (Action Committee to Stop Evictions) in Johannesburg as well as a member of the UDF pre-1994. He has held many positions in different community organisations, including Chairperson of Crisis Careline school governing bodies, body corporates and providing legal assistance. He was a member of the Inkatha Freedom Party (IFP) before he was a member of the NFP. He is a founding member of the NFP.

For more about Mr Shaik-Emam, read his [blog post](http://www.pa.org.za/blog/munzoor-shaik-emam-nfp "shaik").

Ms Dreyer was born in the then Transvaal. She obtained a Masters degree in clinical psychology from Rand Afrikaans University (RAU). She entered the political scene in 1978 working as a volunteer for the old PFP. She was first elected as a DA Member of Parliament, where she served as the DA’s spoke person on Labour. In 2009 she was re-elected to Parliament as Shadow Minister of Public Service and Administration and is currently serving as the Shadow Minister of Public Works. Source: DA (http://www.da.org.za)

persons.name: Andricus Pieter Van der Westhuizen
persons.summary:
Andricus Pieter Van der Westhuizen's plenary attendance record for Feb-Apr [2013](/file_archive/Andricus-Van-der-Westhuizen-Attendance-2013 "Andricus Van der Westhuizen") and [2012](/file_archive/Andricus-Van-der-Westhuizen-Attendance-2012 "Andricus Van der Westhuizen").

Mr van der Westhuizen was raised in Stellenbosch in the Western Cape. He obtained a BCom degree and a Diploma in Higher Education, and a Masters Degree in Educational Leadership and Development from Stellenbosch University. Before entering the political arena, Mr van der Westhuizen worked at Old Mutual as a trainee manager for a very brief period and opted for a career in the education sector. He was later appointed as the Deputy-Chief Education Specialist in the Directorate: Quality Assurance of the Western Cape Education Department. Before his election to Parliament in 2009, Mr van der Westhuizen was involved in local government and got elected as the DA’s speaker of the Stellenbosch Council. He is currently appointed as the Shadow Deputy Minister of Labour. Source: DA (http://www.da.org.za).

persons.biography: Deputy Minister Nel has held his current portfolio since May 2009 and has been a Member of Parliament for the African National Congress (ANC) since 1994. He holds a Bachelor of Civil Law from the University of Pretoria. He served as whip of Portfolio Committee on Justice and House Whip. Between 2006 and 2007 he served as Acting Chief Whip of the African National Congress (ANC) and as a Chairperson of House of the National Assembly between 2008 and 2009. He had served on various Portfolio Committees including Justice and Constitutional Development, Correctional Services, Health, Home Affairs, and Communications. He also served as a member of the Standing Committee on Public Accounts (SCOPA). Deputy Minister Nel was involved in the End Conscription Campaign, and had been active in politics since high school in Sao Paulo, Brazil. Source: (info.gov.za)

persons.name: Angela Thokozile Didiza
persons.summary:
Ms Angela Thoko Didiza was born in Durban on the 02 of June 1965. She became Minister of Agriculture and Land  Affairs in 1999 and in 2006 she became Minister of Public works under President Thabo Mbeki. When Mbeki was ousted from his position as President in 2008, she was one of the ten Ministers that resigned. Ms Didiza is currently a Project Consultant for the Archie Mafeje Research Institute at the University of South Africa. She also serves as a representative on the Judicial Services Commision, since June 2014.

She holds an honours degree in Politics. She is also married with five children. Source: [sahistory.org.za](http://whoswho.co.za/thoko-didiza-926 "bio")
She holds a has  BA (Hons). She is married and has five children. She was selected as one of the Young Global Leaders by the Forum of Young Global Leaders in 2004. source: [wikipedia.org](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thoko_Didiza "bio")

persons.name: Annelie Lotriet
persons.summary:
Annelie Lotriet's plenary attendance record for Feb-Apr [2013](/file_archive/Annelie-Lotriet-Attendance-2013 "Annelie Lotriet") and [2012](/file_archive/Annelie-Lotriet-Attendance-2012 "Annelie Lotriet").

Dr Lotriet was born in Johannesburg. She completed her post-secondary education at Rand Afrikaans University where she graduated with a BA degree in Languages. She continued her studies and completed a Doctorate degree in Education specializing in higher education. Before making her entrance into South African politics she worked in academia and lectured at both Vista University and the University of the Free State. In 2000 she was appointed as a ward councilor for the DA in Mangaung and served on number of provincial and national committees, boards and associations and previously served as the DA Shadow Minister of Higher Education. Source: DA (http://www.da.org.za).

persons.biography: Ms van Wyk was born in Pretoria. After completing her studies at the University of Potchefstroom, she worked for Military Intelligence. Thereafter, she accepted a position at the Human Sciences Research Council. She joined the National Party in 1987 and served as member of the Gauteng Legislature from 1994-1997. She then resigned to help Roelf Meyer form the UDM. She joined the ANC in 2003.

persons.summary:
Annette Steyn's plenary attendance record for Feb-Apr [2013](/file_archive/Annette-Steyn-Attendance-2013 "Annette Steyn") and [2012](/file_archive/Annette-Steyn-Attendance-2012 "Annette Steyn").

Ms Steyn was first elected to Parliament in 2009. She has executed duties as Councillor for the Gariep Municipality and was appointed as the chairperson of the DA in the Eastern Cape. Annette is currently serving as the DA’s Shadow Minister of Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries. She remains the DA's  Shadow Minister for  Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries in the fifth Parliament. Source: DA (http://www.da.org.za).

persons.biography:
Annette Theresa Lovemore was born on 20 December 1958. She graduated from Kimberly Girls’ High School in 1975 and went on to receive her BSc at University of Cape Town in 1978.Ms Lovemore is the DA’s former Shadow Minister of Home Affairs. She has continuously brought to light the inadequacies of handling of the refugee applicants within South Africa, laws that could hurt the prospects of foreign investments into the country, and the Department of Home Affairs seemingly nonchalant handling of ID, grant and pension fraud happening from foreigners illegally in South Africa. source: [wikipedia.org](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Annette_Lovemore "bio") 
She currently serves as the DA's shadow Minister for Basic Education, since June 2014. Prior to her election to Parliament in 2009, she served as a Councilor in the Nelson Mandela Bay Municipality.

persons.biography: Adv. Anton De Waal Alberts was born in 1970 and completed his high schooling at Hoërskool Roodeport.  He completed an LLB Degree at the University of Johannesburg (UJ). In 1994 he also completed a Human Rights Litigation Diploma at the same institution. He was admitted as an advocate in 1996. He also read for a Masters in International Law at UJ in 1998, completed an Executive Business Certificate at the University of Manchester and obtained a Technical Film and Television Directing Certificate from Monash University. He lectured Law at the former Technikon SA (now part of UNISA) and was as a part-time lecturer at the University of Johannesburg, Wits University and Rhodes University respectively. Adv. Alberts is the chairperson of the FF+ Information and Marketing Committee. He has been in Parliament since 2009.

persons.biography:
Mr Archibold Mzuvukile Figlan was born on the 22 of July 1958 in Salt River, Cape Town. He finished his high school grades at Matanzima High School in the Eastern Cape.He is part of the Class of 2013 graduates in leadership and governance. He once owned a food outlet, then worked for the JD Group's Russels Furnitures. His political career started in 2001 when he was involved in establishing DA structures in the African townships of Cape Town. He became the chairperson of the Lagunya constituency and a member of the metro executive for 3years,whereafter he became a Councillor at the city of Cape Town in 2006. He went on to work as the Sub council chairperson in 2007-2009 at Miranda Ngculu sub council 14 Gugulethu. In 2009 he became a National assemble member of parliament and remained the constituency head of Lagunya. 
His first portfolio at the DA was that of deputy shadow minister of human settlement. In 2011 he was a member of provincial parliament in the western cape and the chairperson of human settlement till 2014, when he returned to the national assemble as the Deputy shadow minister of home affairs.

persons.biography: Mr Watson matriculated in 1962 and went on to further his studies in commerce and management and worked at the maize board until 1965. Mr Watson's political career began in 1965 as a member of the National Party.He served at local government level in Mpumalanga for many years and on several different councils. He joined the DA in 2000 and went on to hold several high profile positions in the Mpumalanga Provincial structures, including Provincial Director. Mr Watson was first elected to parliament in 2000 and then again in 2004 as a permanent delegate to the NCOP for the Mpumalanga Province where he was appointed DA Leader in the NCOP. He sits on the NCOP Select Committees on Land, Agriculture, Water Affairs, Nature Conservation, Tourism and Public services. Mr Watson was re-appointed as DA Leader in the NCOP on his re-election to Parliament in 2009. He has a love of languages and speaks many fluently including isiXhosa, isiZulu, Sesotho, Ndebele, siSwati and Setswana. He loves nature conservation, travel and outdoor living. Source: www.da.org.za/our_people

persons.name: Arron Cecil Steyn
persons.summary:
Arron Cecil Steyn's plenary attendance record for Feb-Apr [2013](/file_archive/Arron-Cecil-Steyn-Attendance-2013 "Arron Cecil Steyn") and [2012](/file_archive/Arron-Cecil-Steyn-Attendance-2012 "Arron Cecil Steyn").

Before entering the political arena, Mr Steyn was employed as a civil engineer and provided architectural consulting services. This led to the establishment of his own company of which he became the Managing Director and was also involved in project management in the oil industry. He was elected to Parliament in 2004 and was appointed as a representative of the DA in the Gauteng Legislature from 1999 to 2004. Mr Steyn is currently appointed as the Shadow Deputy Minister of Education for the DA. Source: DA (www.da.org.za).

persons.biography: Mr. Arthur Roy Ainslie has been an MP since 1999. He holds a BA from UCT, and Economic and Public Finance Certificate from Unisa and a B. Com honours degree from UWC. He was a member of KwaZulu-Natal MPL from 1994 to 1999 and has appeared on the PC Environmental Affairs and Tourism Committee, the PC Public Works and the PC Science and Technology. Mr. Ainslie is currently the ANC Greater Kwadukuza Regional Treasurer, Umhlanga Community Development Trust Chairperson, ANC Kwadukuza region KZN ex-officio and the Joint editor of Journal Natal. He is interested in development, poverty elimination and job creation and would like to see more people participating in government programmes. Source: ANC (www.anc.org.za)

persons.biography: Deputy Minister Dlodlo is the Deputy Minister of Public Service and Administration of the Republic of South Africa since 1 November 2010. She holds a number of post graduate qualifications in Management Development; Business Management and Executive Development Programme. Her colorful CV includes working for public enterprises as Telkom, and Portnet; Sanlam in various portfolios such as Human Resources, Transport, Strategic information and Industrial Relations. She is an ex-Umkhonto Wesizwe cadre. Source: (info.gov.za)

persons.biography: Ms Muthambi has been a Member of Parliament of the Republic of South Africa and the Pan African Parliament since April 2009. Among her string of qualifications, she obtained a BProc degree from the University of Venda in 1996 and completed her Attorney's Admission Exam in 2000. She is an admitted attorney of the High Court of South Africa. She was the Chief Whip of the Portfolio Committee on Communications and served in the Standing Committee on Public Accounts (SCOPA). She has worked as a Senior Manager: Corporate Services in the Mutale Municipality and as Manager: Labour Relations in the Limpopo Premier’s Office. Source: (gov.za)

persons.name: Baleka Mbete
persons.summary: Baleka Mbete, born 24 September 1949, has been Speaker of the National Assembly of South Africa since 21 May 2014. Previously she was Speaker of the National Assembly from 2004 to 2008 and Deputy President of South Africa from 2008 to 2009 under Kgalema Motlanthe. She was elected National Chairperson of the African National Congress (ANC) in 2007 and re-elected in 2012. (Source: Wikipedia)

persons.biography: Harrington Bantubonke Holomisa was born on 25 July 1955 in the Mqanduli district of Transkei. After attending the Upper Ngqungqu Primary School in Mqanduli, he proceeded to the Jongilizwe College for the Sons of Chiefs and Headmen in Tsolo, Transkei, where he matriculated in 1975. He has served as the Deputy Minister of Environment and Tourism of South Africa in the Government of National Unity (elected in 1994). He co-founded the United Democratic Movement in 1997 with Mr Roelf Meyer and continues to serve as its President. Mr Holomisa is a fervent advocate for the environment and is working towards the establishment of the Champions of the Environment Foundation. He is married with two children.

persons.biography: Deputy Minister Thompson was born on 03 February 1954. She has been a Member of Parliament since 1995 and she was Chairperson of the Portfolio Committee on Women, Children and People with Disabilities. She served various Portfolio Committees including Public Works, Land and Agriculture, Joint Monitoring Committee on the Improvement of the Quality of Life and Status of Women. During her political career she has served in various positions such as a Regional Secretary of ANC Women League (ANCWL) in KZN. The Deputy Minister obtained a Certificate in Leadership Comunication and a Certificate in Government and Business Policy from Rhodes University. She has dedicated her strength in the areas of Skills Development for Women and Rural Development. Source: (info.gov.za)

persons.biography: Minister Dlamini holds a Bachelor of Arts Degree in Social Studies from the University of Zululand. She became an active member of the Idlangamabala Youth at Imbali's St Marks Anglican Church as well as the South African Students Congress. She worked with various structures including the Congress of South Africa Trade Unions. She became part of the interim leadership formed to build the ANC Women’s League in the KZN regions in 1991, and became Deputy Secretary General of the ANCWL in 1993. She became a member of NEC of the ANC as well as the National Working Committee in 2007. Source: (gov.za)

persons.biography:
Professor Belinda Bozzoli was formerly the Head of the School of Social Sciences and then Deputy Vice Chancellor (Research) of the University of the Witwatersrand, she is the author of three single-authored, internationally published books and editor or co-editor of a further four; and the author of 26 articles. In 2006 she was awarded an A-rating from the National research Foundation making her the first sociologist to be honoured in this way. In addition to being Acting Director of WISER, she is now also Senior Adviser to the Vice-Chancellor in which capacity she is working on a major research development project for the University. She completed her Bachelor of Arts and Honours degrees at the University of Witwatersrand; she then read for her Master of Arts and Doctor of Philosophy at the University of Sussex. She was an Associate Fellow at Yale University in 1978 - 1979. source: [whoswho.co.za](http://whoswho.co.za/belinda-bozzoli-5602 "bio").
She comes into the fifth Parliament as the DA's shadow Minister for Higher Education and training.
persons.name: Belinda Bozzoli
persons.summary:
Professor Belinda Bozzoli is the author of three single-authored, internationally published books and editor or co-editor of a further four; and the author of 26 articles. In 2006 she was awarded an A-rating from the National research Foundation making her the first sociologist to be honoured in this way. In addition to being Acting Director of WISER, she is now also Senior Adviser to the Vice-Chancellor in which capacity she is working on a major research development project for the University. She completed her Bachelor of Arts and Honours degrees at the University of Witwatersrand (WITS); she then read for her Master of Arts and Doctor of Philosophy at the University of Sussex. She was an Associate Fellow at Yale University in 1978 - 1979. source: [whoswho.co.za](http://whoswho.co.za/belinda-bozzoli-5602 "bio").
She became Deputy Vice-Chancellor of WITS in 2002, and amongst other things chaired the Board of the National Research Foundation for a time. She was elected as a DA MP in May 2014, and is political head of the Boksburg West constituency, an area which includes many informal settlements, Reiger Park, parts of Vosloorus, Freeway Park and other communities. She is Shadow Minister for Higher Education and Training.

persons.biography: Mr Martins was born on 02 September 1956. He holds a Master of Law degree in International Law from the University of Cape Town; and a Bachelor of Law degree from the University of Natal. He was a member of the Black Consciousness Movement in the 1970s. Between 1983 and 1991 he was charged and imprisoned for eight years in Robben Island and Johannesburg. He had been a Member of Parliament since 1994, and had chaired the Portfolio Committee on Home Affairs. The Minister is a member of the Political Bureau and Central Committee of the South African Communist Party (SACP). Source: (info.gov.za)

persons.biography: Mr Mzwenqaba Bhanga was a Congress of the People representative in the 4th parliament of South Africa.  He currently is the Democratic Alliances’ Shadow Minister of Co-operative Governance and Traditional Affairs.  He read for a Public Management qualification at the Nelson Mandela Metropolitan University (NMMU) where he is completing research in maritime studies.  He is a former National General Secretary of the South African Students Congress (SASCO).  He was also a deputy chairperson of the African National Congress Youth League (ANCYL). He once chaired the regional branch of the Congress of South African Students (COSAS) in the Eastern Cape.

persons.biography: Ms Mabe was born on 18 September 1976 in Magaliesburg. She attained a Degree in Public Administration from the University of Pretoria and became a Member of Parliament in 2009. Ms Mabe also serves on the Select Committee on Land and Environmental Affairs, Agriculture, Forestry & Fisheries, Rural Development & Land Reform, Water & Environmental Affairs, is on the ANC Finance Committee, and has been a member of the ANC Youth League.

persons.biography: Mr Bheki Cele was born on the 22 April 1952. He currently serves as the Deputy Minister of Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries since 25 May 2014. He is a member of the National Executive Committee of the African National Congress, and formerly served as MEC for Transport, Community Safety Liaison in KwaZulu-Natal. He served as the National Commissioner of the South African Police Service until he was suspended from the position, pending investigation, in October 2011. In June 2012 he was officially fired from the position. He serves as a member of the KwaZulu-Natal Provincial Legislature and a Member of the KwaZulu-Natal Executive Council. Moreover he was a Founding Member for National Education Union of South Africa. Source: gov.za

persons.biography: Minister Molewa was born on 23 March 1957. The provincial Chairperson of the African National Congress WL (NW) is currently studying towards a B.Com degree with UNISA. She taught at Moloto and Makaunyane Secondary Schools from 1976 to 1981, but also was involved in the underground structures of the liberation movement since 1976 until 1990. Prior to her appointment as Minister of Water and Environmental Affairs, she served as Minister of Social Development and Premier of North West. She was the first woman Chairperson of the Portfolio Committee on Trade and Industry from 1994 to 1996. Source: (gov.za)

persons.biography: Deputy Minister Ntuli holds a B.Com Honours degree in Information Systems from University of the Western Cape and obtained an Advanced Diploma in Economic policy from the same institution. She was trained in Managing economic strategies and micro economic policy reform; and in Implementation of sustainable strategies in a globalising world from Williams College in US. She became a Member of Parliament in 1994, and had served on various Parliamentary Committees, including the Joint Monitoring Committee on Improvement of Quality of Life and Status of women; and Portfolio Committee on Trade and Industry. Prior to her appointment, she was Deputy Minister of Trade and Industry from 2009 until 2010. Source: (info.gov.za)

persons.biography: Minister Nzimande was born on 14 April 1958. The current General Secretary of the South African Communist Party holds a Doctorate in Philosophy specializing in Sociology from the University of Natal. Dr Nzimande lectured at the University of Zululand in 1985, and was a lecturer for Industrial Psychology at the University of Natal in 1987. He had served Parliament as Chairperson of the Parliamentary Select Committee on Education, and had held various leadership positions at SA universities. He has written a book titled "Children of wars: the impact of violence on schooling in Natal". Source: (gov.za)

persons.name: Cassel Charlie Mathale
persons.summary: Mr Mathale was born on 23 January 1961. He completed his secondary education at Phangasasa High School in Tzaneen and continued his studies at the University of the Western Cape where he obtained a Bachelor of Arts degree. He was the Premier of Limpopo Province until July 2013. Mr Mathale was in addition appointed as the Provincial Secretary for the ANC in Limpopo and a member of the ANCYL National Executive Committee from 1996 to 1998. He has served on the Portfolio Committees on Human Settlements, and Science and Technology as a representative for the ANC and executing duties as the Provincial Chairperson of Limpopo for the ANC.

persons.biography: Mr Burgess received his BA from the University of South Africa (Unisa). He was a member of the Portfolio Committee on Joint Constitutional Review, the Portfolio Committee on Correctional Services and the Portfolio Committee on Justice & Constitutional Development. Mr Burgess also practices law, previously having worked as a human rights attorney and currently serving as a practicing attorney for Burgess & Associates.

persons.biography: Mr Charles Danny Kekana has been a Member of Parliament since 2004. He currently serves as the ANC representative on the Magistrate Commission. He is the former Mayor of Greater Johannesburg; Mayor of Soweto and worked at the ANC Diepkloof Parliamentary office; ANC REC Johannesburg. He was the  ANC Chairperson for the Soweto sub-region; ANC Executive Diepkloof branch; Student activist;Johannesburg REC; Soweto sub-region. He holds degrees in BA (Univ. of the North); BA Hons (Wits); MA. source: [anc.org.za](http://http://www.anc.org.za/caucus/get_mp.php?q=125 "bio")

persons.name: Charles Nqakula
persons.summary: Mr Nqakula started his career as a journalist, covering political news from 1966 to 1982. He began his political career as a Publicity Secretary for the United Democratic Front (1983) and joined the South African Communist Party in 1991 but was appointed as a MP and Member of the National Executive Committee for the ANC in 1994. Mr Nqakula was selected as a Parliamentary Councilor for the Office of the President in 1999 and became a Deputy Minister for the Department of Home Affairs in 2001. In 2002 he became the Minister for Safety and Security and thereafter the Minister of Defense (2008-2009). He has been the National Chairman for the South African Communist Party since 1999; Political Advisory to the Presidency since 2009; and the High Commissioner for the Republic of Mozambique since May 2012. (Source: whoswho.co.za)

persons.biography: Cheryllyn Dudley took office as an ACDP member of the National Assembly in Parliament in June 1999. She has been the ACDP Parliamentary Whip since September 2005 and was elected Chief Whip of smaller political parties during the 3rd and 5th democratic parliaments. She is married, has four children and three grandchildren.  She completed her  LLB law studies through UNISA. Prior to 1999 she served within the party structures at Branch, Regional, Povincial and National levels for 6 years before taking office in Parliament.

persons.name: Christopher Lancaster Gololo
persons.summary:
Mr Gololo joined the ANC in 1977 in Tanzania having worked for the ANC in Mpumalanga on return from exile in 1993. He spent his exile years in Tanzania, Cuba, Czechoslovakia and India. Mr Gololo also served as the Regional Membership Administrator of the ANC (1994-2004) before joining Parliament. His Matric was obtained from the Bunya Secondary School thereafter obtaining a certificate in Electrotechnics from Eduardo Garcia Delgado in Cuba, a certificate in Administration in Czechoslavakia, a Diploma in Management from India and a Diploma in Management from the Institute of Development Management in Morogoro, Tanzania) (Source: anc.org.za)

persons.biography: Minister September occupied the Human Settlements portfolio following the recall of Minister Sexwale on 10 July 2013. She had been a Member of Parliament for the African National Congress (ANC) since 1999, and served on various Portfolio Committees. She had formerly served as Chairperson for the Portfolio Committee on Water Affairs & Forestry, but also served as Chief Whip in the National Assembly from 2004 until her appointment. The Minister obtained a Masters degree in Economics from Warwick University. The former trade unionist worked at Rex TrueForm factory for longer than 20 years. Source: (gov.za) . Ms September currently serves as the ANC representative on the Magistrate Commision as of June 2014

persons.biography: Cornelius Petrus Mulder obtained a B.Juris degree from the University of Potchefstroom, with International Politics and Political Science as elective modules in 1980. In 1982 he completed an LL.B at the same institution.  He later completed doctoral research at the Institute for Advanced Legal Studies at the University of London and the Max-Planck-Institut für Ausländisches öffentliches Recht und Völkerrecht at Heidelberg, Germany. He has been in Parliament since 1994. Mr Mulder is the FF+ Chief Whip in Parliament and leader of the Western Cape FF+ constituency. He chairs the party’s Policy and Constitution committee.

persons.biography: Ms. Dalitha Fiki Boshigo is an MP in the ANC parliamentary caucus. She has a diploma in Business Management and certificates in Social Development, Sector Policing and Rural Development Management. persons.biography: Mr Van Rooyen got involved in politics in the mid - 1980s. He was an MK operative and soldier, and held various leadership positions in COSAS, Khutsong Student Congress, UDF Representative, NUM Member. He also held a number of leadership positions in the ANC from 1994 to 2007. Mr Van Rooyen holds an advance Business Management Diploma, a Diploma in Municipal Governance, a certificate in Municipal Governance, a certificate in Councillor Development, a certificate in Municipal Finance, a certificate in Economic & Public Finance and a Masters Degree in Public Development and Management. He has personal interests in soccer, golf, tennis, reading and hunting. Source: (anc.org.za)

persons.biography: Mr Maynier is a Shadow Minister of Defence and Military Veterans for the Democratic Alliance. After matriculating in 1986, he completed his 'national service' as a submarine officer and navy diver in the South African Navy in 1989. In 1996 he graduated from the University of Cape Town with honours, where he majored in politics and economics. In 2008, David graduated with a Masters Degree in Public Administration from Harvard University. After returning home, Mr Maynier appointed as campaign manager in the Western Cape where the party won an outright majority. He was elected as a Member of Parliament in 2009. Source: www.da.org.za/our_people

Ms Schafer was born in Pietermaritzburg and completed her secondary education in Cape Town. She obtained a BA degree in English and Psychology from the University of Cape Town and later completed an LLB degree.  She practiced law for a period of twelve years prior to starting her political career.  Debbie joined the DP in 1999 and served as a ward councilor. She was first elected to Parliament in 2009 and is currently executing duties as the Shadow Deputy Minister of Justice and Constitutional Development and also serves as the Deputy Chairperson of the Regional Executive in the City of Cape Town, a member of the Provincial Disciplinary Committee and the Registrar of the DA Federal Legal Commission. Source: DA (http://www.da.org.za).

persons.name: Deidre Carter
persons.summary: Deputy General Secretary of COPE, Ms Deidre Carter, hails from the Free State, but currently lives in KwaZulu-Natal. She has extensive administrative experience and is skilled in the areas of human resources, credit control, sales, fleet control and the like. Ms Carter represents COPE as a Member of Parliament. She serves on the Portfolio Committee for Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries, as well as Rural Development. She is an active motorcyclist who participates in many road safety projects and charity runs.

Ms Robinson grew up in Queenstown but has lived in Cape Town for many years. She completed her post-secondary education at Rhodes University and attained a Bachelor of Arts degree majoring in English and History and in addition completed a University Education Diploma. Prior to joining South African politics, Ms Robinson worked as a teacher and later started a career as a language adviser and translator. On her entry into politics in 1998, she became a Proportional Representative councilor for the DP and was elected as ward councilor for the City of Cape Town in 2000 as a representative for the DA. Denise was appointed as the Shadow Minister of Women, Youth, Children and People with Disabilities in 2009 and is currently serving as the Deputy Shadow Minister of Health for the DA. Source: DA (http://www.da.org.za).

persons.biography: Minister Hanekom was born on 13 January 1953. He attended school at Jan van Riebeeck Secondary school, and after his compulsory conscription, traveled abroad. He worked for various organisations and on farms, factories and building sites. He returned to SA and practised farming for six years. He worked with the trade union movement in Johannesburg before being deported to Zimbabwe with his wife in 1987. He returned in 1990, and worked at the headquarters of the ANC, where he was responsible for policy formulation on land and agricultural matters. Source: (gov.za)

persons.biography:
Kohler Barnard hails from Port Elizabeth. Prior to joining the DA in 2004 she worked as a radio and print journalist and has traveled abroad extensively. She previously worked for the SABC, SAfm radio and became the Chairperson of BEMAWU-KZN (Broadcast, Electronic Media and Allied Workers Union) in 2001. Whilst employed at the SABC she became one of the founding members of the inaugural SABC HIV/Aids Committee and in addition served on the Gender Committee, the Security Task Force and Regional Management Committee. After being re-elected to Parliament in 2009, Dianne was appointed as the Shadow Minister of Police. [Source: DA (http://www.da.org.za)]

Kohler-Barnard moved to politics in response to increasing state interference in the management of the SABC. She was elected to Parliament with the Democratic Alliance in 2004, and was initially spokesperson on Arts and Culture. She was subsequently appointed opposition spokesperson on Health. During this time she became a vocal critic of incumbent Health Minister Manto Tshabalala-Msimang, particularly over her support for controversial German vitamin salesman Matthias Rath. Subsequently, Kohler Barnard was appointed to the senior position of Shadow Minister for the party on Police. She was also the DA’s representative on the SADC observer mission to Zimbabwe for the last two elections in that country. [Source: Wikipedia]

persons.biography:
Ms Dikeledi Phillistus Magadzi serves as a Judicial Services Commision representative, as of June 2014. She formerly was a Member of the Executive Council(MEC)responsible for the
Department of Health and Social Development in the Limpopo Provincial Government. She was also a member of the Federation of South African Women and the UDF from 1985 -1990. Between 1987-1994, Ms Magadzi, was a member of NEHAWU. She then became a member of the Limpopo Provincial legislature since 1994. She is also the former MEC for Public Works. In her political leadership under the Department of Public Works, she played a major role in leading the integration and transformation of the 3 former homelands (department of Public Works). Her role in serving the public and ensuring a better life for all can be summarized as follows:

1990 - 1996 : Executive Member of the ANC Women's League
1994 - 2008 : Member of the Executive Council (PEC) of ANC
2007 - to date: ANC NEC Member
2010 - to date : ANCWL Provincial Deputy Chairperson
Career & Leadership 
Some of her previous positions and portfolio include:
1994 -1998 : MEC for the Department of Public Works in Limpopo
1999 - 2001: Deputy Chief Whip of the Provincial Legislature
2001-2004: MEC for the Department of Safety and Security Liaison
2004 to May 2009 : MEC for Agriculture
2009 to Jan 2010: MEC for Safety and Security Liaison
1996-2005 : Chairperson of the Advisory Council - Pretoria Technikon
Ms Magadzi is married and has five children and two grand children. Source: [dhsd.limpopo.gov.za](http://www.dhsd.limpopo.gov.za/index.php?page=mec_profile "bio")

persons.biography: Ms Dikeledi Rebecca Tsotetsi is currently the Chief Whip of the ANC for the Portfolio Committee on Postal and Telecommunications. She has been an MPL (Gauteng) from 1999-2006 and became the Party Whip in 2004.She became the Deputy Chief Whip in 2005-2006 and was Redeployed to Emfuleni Local Municipality as Executive Mayor from 2006-2008.She became an NCOP member from 2008 in the National Assembly. She was the ANCWL Branch Secretary in 1995 and The Federation of Transvaal Women (FEDTRAW) Secretary. She later became an Organiser in the 1980's and was detained Parent Support Committee Secretary in that decade. She has been a member of the SACP since 1995-to-date and a  Member of the Regional Executive Committee. She holds BA Masters in Industrial Pyschology & Industrial Sociology (1995-1998); Honours in Political Science (2002); Masters-Development Science (2006 Exams completed and Research Outstanding Finance & Economic Development Certifiacte with Unisa(2001).A 12 Month Certificate programme passed two of four subjects in Communications training by the Gauteng Provincial legislature. She also completed Public Finance Management training by the Gauteng Provincial legislature. source: [anc.org.za](http://www.anc.org.za/caucus/get_mp.php?q=528 "bio")

persons.name: Dina Deliwe Pule
persons.summary:
Ms Pule started her political career while in college as the Secretary of the Student Representative Council at the Eastern Cape Mango College of Education (1987 – 1988). She was a Founder-Member of the South African National Students' Congress. From 2008 to 2009 she was a Member of the Executive Council within the Sports Arts and Recreation branch for the Government of South Africa. Ms Pule has served in various ministerial positions, including, Deputy Minister of Communications (2009 – 2010), Deputy Minister in the Presidency for Performance Monitoring and Evaluation (2010 – 2011) and Minister of Communications (2011 to July 2013). As of 2014 she had served as a Member of the Provincial Executive Council for Agriculture and Land Administration in Mpumalanga. (Source: whoswho.co.za)

Dina Deliwe Pule's plenary attendance record for Feb-Apr [2013](/file_archive/dina-deliwe-pule-attendance-2013 "Pule Attendance 2013") and [2012](/file_archive/dina-deliwe-pule-attendance-2012 "Pule Attendance 2012").

persons.biography: Mr George went to Wits University, after completing his undergraduate degree and compulsory national service; he entered the financial services industry where he built his career. During this time he was also a community activist, this later prompted his political career. He further acquired a BA (Hons), MBA (Wits) and DBL (Economics) degrees and an Advanced Certificate in Municipal Governance. His MBA research report received the Investec Securities Prize for the Best Research in the field of Investments. He joined the Democratic Party in 1995 and, in 2005, was elected chairman of the DA branch in Sandown, Sandton. After the 2006 municipal elections, he served the City of Johannesburg as a PR councillor on various committees, including housing, finance and economic development and municipal accounts. In 2008 he joined parliament and served on the Finance Committee. Since 2012 he has served as Shadow Minister for SCOPA. Source: www.da.org.za/our_people

persons.name: Dipuo Bertha Letsatsi-Duba
persons.summary: Ms letsastsi-Duba was born and raised in Gauteng. She completed her secondary education at Luanshya Girls High School in Zambia and completed a Diploma in Political Science in Cuba in 1987. She has also completed a Diploma in Mass Communication from Zimbabwe Harare Polytech. In 1982 she went into exile to join the ANC and Umkhonto we Sizwe. She also worked as the editor in chief of Voice of Women (ANC Women’s Jornal) and as a Media Liaison Officer in the ANC Headquarters (Shell House) from 1992 to 1994. In 2007 she was elected to serve the Provincial Executive Committee and as Provincial Treasurer of the ANC in 2008.  She is a Member of the Limpopo Legislature and MEC for Agriculture.

Born in Pietermaritzburg South Africa, Ms Desiree van der Walt n a Member of Limpopo Provincial Legislature for the Democratic Alliance. She was the Democratic Leader for the Limpopo Province until June 2012. She formerly was in the corporate world through a banking institution for nine years. She is also a former National Spokesperson for Arts and Culture  in the Democratic Alliance
from 2004 - 2010. Ms Van der Walt was Ward Councillor in the Roodepoort City Council from
1995 - 2000. source: [whoswho.co.za](http://whoswho.co.za/desiree-van-der-walt "bio").

persons.biography: Deputy Minister Ebrahim is a member of the African National Congress (ANC) National Executive Committee (NEC). Born on 01 July 1937, he joined the liberation movement as a youth activist in 1952, and participated in the Congress of the People Campaign, which adopted the Freedom Charter in 1955. An ex-combatant of Umkhonto Wesizwe, he was arrested and charged under the Sabotage Act in 1961. Sentenced to 15 years imprisonment at Robben Island, he was released in 1979. He went to exile on instruction of the ANC in 1980. The Deputy Minister holds a Bachelor of Arts and a B.Com Degrees from the University of South Africa. Source: (info.gov.za)

persons.biography: Mr Patel has an extensive amount of experience and accomplishments. He has been heavily involved in labour-government issues as he was the Chief Negotiator on the Labour Relations Act of 1995 and the acting (as of 2014) President of the South African Labour Research Institute. He is also involved in higher education, working with multiply universities. He has been Chief Negotiator for the National Bargaining Council for the Clothing Industry (2002) and the National Textile Bargaining Council (2003). He served as the Minister of Economic Development from 2009 – 2014. (Source: anc.org.za)

persons.biography: Minister Peters was born on 13 May 1960. She holds a Bachelor of Arts degree in Social Work from University of the North obtained in 1987. Between 1994 and 1997, she was Member of Parliament during which time she served in the Portfolio Committees on Home Affairs, Public Works, Social Services and Health. The Minister returned to the NC where she served in various portfolios including health, and also as the Premier. Prior to being moved to the Transport portfolio, she was Minister of the Energy Department since 2009. She holds various leadership and development certificates from notable institutions as Havana in Cuba, the University of Cape Town and the University of the Western Cape. Source: (gov.za)

persons.biography: Deputy Minister Thabethe was born on 26 September 1959 and had been a Member of Parliament since 1994. She completed a Certificate in Economics with University of South Africa (UNISA) and an Advanced Diploma in Economics in 2008. She was a Co-coordinator of the East Rand Women’s League RTT structure, a member of ANC National Parliamentary Caucus, Gauteng Provincial Whip and a House Whip from 1996 to 2004. She Chaired the Portfolio Committee on Environmental Affairs and Tourism between 2004 and June 2005, but also was a Member of the Committees on Labour and Trade and Industry. Source: (info.gov.za)

persons.biography: Ms Ellen Molekane is the Deputy Minister of State Security of the Republic of South Africa since 26 MAy 2014. She formerly was the Deputy Director General of the Ministry of Defence and Military Veterans. She trained in the then German Democratic Republic (GDR), during the time of the People’s Army Umkhonto we Sizwe (MK) where she did a Commander’s course and specialized in military engineering. Moreover she was the only woman in that course at that time. source: [dmv.gov.za](http://www.dmv.gov.za/documents/July%202013.pdf "bio")

persons.biography: Ms Coleman holds a degree in Developmental Studies at UWC, a certificate in Public Relations from Damelin, and a certificate in Finance & Economic with UNISA. She also holds several Certificates of Attendance from various academic institutions. Embarking on her political career in the early 1990s, Ms Coleman has since played a very active role in government, serving as the Portfolio Committee of Local Government and Housing Chair, the MEC for Health (2003-04), Finance (2004-08) and Education (2008-09) among other roles. She is currently the Chairperson of the PC on Economic Development. Source: ANC (www.anc.org.za)

persons.name: Emma More
persons.summary:
Emma More's plenary attendance record for Feb-Apr [2013](/file_archive/Emma-More-Attendance-2013 "Emma More") and [2012](/file_archive/Emma-More-Attendance-2012 "Emma More")

Ms More was born and grew up in Soweto. After completing her secondary education in 1991 she furthered her studies at Technikon Witwatersrand. She qualified as a radiographer and completed a number of other qualifications in HIV/AIDS Counseling and Management, African Management, Hospital Management, Public Financial Management and is currently busy completing a Masters Degree in Public Development and Management at WITS University. After a successful career in the public health sector, Emma made her entry into South African politics and joined the DA in 2008. She was initially involved with canvassing work for the party in Kempton Park and managed seven stations for Ward 58 during the 2009 elections. Emma is currently appointed as the Shadow Deputy Minister of Social Development for the DA.

persons.biography: Minister Mthethwa was born on 23 January 1967 and had been a Member of Parliament since 2002. The Minister holds a Diploma in Community Development from University of Natal; a Certificate in Mining Engineering from University of Johannesburg and a Certificate in Communications and Leadership from Rhodes University. As Member of Parliament, he had served as Chairperson for Minerals and Energy Portfolio Committee from 2004 to 2008; and as Chief Whip of the ANC in 2008. He also served on the Board of Directors of 2010 FIFA World Cup Local Organisation Committee. Source: (gov.za)

persons.biography:
Mr Kebby Emmanuel Ramaotoana Maphatsoe is a trained political soldier of (Umkhonto we Sizwe) MK, and served as the National Chairperson of the military veterans since 2007. He is a former member of the Congress of South African Students (Cosas) and the Soweto Youth Congress (SOYCO), a member of the South African Youth Congress (SAYCO). He went to Angola and the Soviet Union to receive his training and was also exiled in Uganda before returning to South Africa. Under his political direction, Mkhonto weSizwe Military Veterans Association (MKMVA) became an integral component of the ANC and for the first time the association was in the central agenda of the ANC's political framework with the achievement of progressive resolutions. He currently serves as the Deputy Minister of Defence and Military Veterans in the Republic of South Africa from the 26 May 2014.
Source: gov.za

persons.biography: While in exile Mr Ngcobo completed his MSc programme in the area of In-Core Fuel Management and Control of Nuclear Reactors of VVER-type at the University of Sofia. He was awarded the City Honour by the City Council of Pietermaritzburg for his publications in the field of Nuclear Science and Engineering, as well as for his contribution in local community development programmes. Hon Ngcobo has served as the Chairperson of the Portfolio Committee on Science and Technology and the Chairperson of the Portfolio Committee on Minerals and Energy.

persons.biography: Ms. Faith Claudine Bikani is a current member of the PC on Health and the PC on Public Service and Administration. She holds a diploma in Nursing Administration, Nursing Midwifery, Psychiatry and General Nursing Science as well as an Advanced Nursing Degree, a certificate in Computer Skills and a certificate in Skills Development. Bikani is the current ANC branch deputy secretary, a PEC and PWC member and the head of the Organising and Campaigns sub-committee. Ms. Bikani was previously a BEC Member, the Deputy Secretary in the Joyce Boom Branch and the ANC WL Regional Secretary. Source: ANC (www.anc.org.za)

persons.name: Fatima Hajaig
persons.summary: Ms Hajaig has been a MP since 1994. She has served in various positions in Parliament including the Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs, Member of Portfolio Committee on Trade and Industry, has been part of the JMC on JMC Improvement of Quality of Life and the Status of Women, Member of the Portfolio Committee on Foreign Affairs,  Portfolio Committee on Justice and Constitutional Development, Portfolio Committee on Foreign Affairs (Sub-Committee on International Affairs), the Pan African committee on Justice and Human Rights, SADC-PF Committee on Inter-Parliamentary Cooperation, the Parliamentary Group on International Relations and Parliamentarians For Global Action. Her political career includes membership of the ANCWYL Executive in Gauteng, taking part in the Kempton Park negotiations and membership of the UDF, Patriotic Front, Transvaal Indian Congress and the Transvaal Youth Congress. (Source: anc.org.za)

persons.biography: Deputy Minister Chohan has been Member of Parliament since 1996 and has been the Deputy Minister of Home Affairs since 2010. Chohan holds a B.Proc degree from University of Witwatersrand, was admitted to the side bar in 1998 and is pursuing a Masters Degree in Constitutional Law with Rhodes University. She chaired various Portfolio Committees such as Basic Education, Justice and Constitutional Development and Public Enterprises. Deputy Minister Chohan served as a Legal Advisor in the Gauteng Legislature and Parliamentary Representative on the Magistrates Commission and later became Chairperson of the Western Cape Provincial Committee of the Magistrates Commission. Source: (http://www.info.gov.za)

persons.name: Fezeka Sister Loliwe
persons.summary: Ms Loliwe was a mathematics and science teacher in the Eastern Cape. She holds a Secondary Teachers’ Diploma from Dr WB Rubusana College of Education as well as a BA, Bed and Med degrees. She also studied Project Management and Labour Law. She joined the SA Democratic Teachers Union (SADTU) in 1990. She held various leadership positions in the Union, including that of Provincial Secretary of the Eastern Cape.  She was also the Vice-President for Sports, Arts and Culture at SADTU National (http://www.sihold.co.za/board-of-directors)

persons.biography:
Mr Fezile Bhengu was born on the 06 of August 1954. He served as a Deputy Minister of Defence of the Republic of South Africa until May 11 2009. He also served as a member of Parliament from 1994 to 2009 where he served as African National Congress Parliamentary Whip as well.He was the Chairperson of the Portfolio Committee on Public Works and the Portfolio Committee on Defence. He has been  a member of the Joint Rules Committee and a parliamentary Programming Cluster Whip and Convenor.
Mr Fezile Bhengu holds a B Juris from Fort Hare University. Mr Bhengu had memberships at ANC Branch Executive Committee(BEC),Regional Executive Committee (REC) levels in Transkei and OR Tambo, where he served in the capacities of Secretary for the Transkei region. He was active in the ANC underground structures,the United Democratic Front (UDF) and as a Student. source: gov.za

persons.biography: Mr Mbalula has served as the Minister of Sport and has held various leadership positions since his entry into the South African political arena. He held the positions as President of the Botshabelo Youth Congress from 1986 to 1987, President of the ANCYL from 2004 to 2008 and Secretary-General of the ANCYL from 1998 to 2004. In addition to this, he was appointed as the Area Manager for the United Democratic Front in 1989, Affiliate Member of Socialist International and the Coordinator of the South African Medical and Dental Association. Mr Mbalula holds a Masters Degree in Economics and completed training in Leadership Skills and Counseling.

persons.biography: Mr Majola was born in 1964. He served the youth and UDF structures in the 1980s in the then Southern Transvaal region, where he played a key role in the re-establishment of the ANC and SACP structures. He joined NEHAWU as its Organiser in the Vaal Branch in 1990. He was elected Regional Secretary of NEHAWU Western Transvaal in 1992. He served as NEHAWU’s Assistant General Secretary in an acting capacity in 1994 and was eventually elected to that position in 1995. He became General Secretary in 1998 after being elected in the congress held in Durban. He was re-elected to this position in 2001, 2004 and again in 2007. Source: (nehawu.org.za)

persons.biography: Mr Beukman matriculated at Paarl Boys High in 1983. He obtained the degrees BA (Hons) MA from the University of Stellenbosch and a degree B.Proc LLB from the University of South Africa. He was admitted as an attorney in 1997. He was admitted as a solicitor of the High Court of England and Wales in 2007. He worked as a senior constitutional planner during the multi-party negotiation process. He served for three years as an external member of the SABC Board. As a member of the National Assembly he chaired the Standing Committee for Public Accounts (SCOPA) for three years. He has acted as attorney of record for a cross-section of clients - corporate and individuals- at various fora including the Constitutional Court, other courts and administrative tribunals. Source: (francoisbeukman.co.za)

persons.biography: Deputy Minister Oliphant, could not have occupied a better portfolio than Mineral Resources. Born in Warrenton, in the Diamonds’ province of the Northern Cape, he is currently a member of Central Committee of the South African Communist Party and member of the Task Team of the African National Congress (ANC) in North West Province. He had been a Member of Parliament since 1994 and had served as Chairperson of the Portfolio Committees on Public Works and the Science and Technology, Labour, and Minerals and Energy. He matriculated at Huhudi High School in the Vryburg area and had pursued studies in Economics. He has held various senior position with the tripartite alliance structures, including serving as Vice President of the Congress of South African Trade Union (COSATU). Source: (info.gov.za)

persons.biography:
Mr Gavin Davis matriculated from the Pinelands High School in 1995. He was previously Special Advisor to the Premier of the Western Cape, Helen Zille. He joined the Democratic Alliance as a Researcher in 2004 and was later appointed Chief of Staff in the Leader's Office. He has also served as the Executive Director of Communications at the Democratic Alliance. (Source: [Wikipedia](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gavin_Davis "bio" "Gavin Davis Wiki"))
Mr Davis currently serves as the shadow Minister for Communications in the DA since June 2014.

Mr Davis holds a Bachelor of Arts Degree in history and politics and an Honours Degree in Politics from Rhodes University in Grahamstown, he also acquired an MA in politics from the University of Cape Town. (Source: [Who's who SA](http://whoswho.co.za/gavin-davis-682279 "bio" "Who's Who Gavin Davis.co.za](http://whoswho.co.za/gavin-davis-682279 "bio")

persons.biography: Born in 1948, Mr. George Boinamo is the current Shadow Deputy Minister of Co-operative Governance and Traditional Affairs. Mr. Boinamo completed training to become a teacher at Hebron College of Education in 1978, completed his BA Ed. at the University of the Witwatersrand and then obtained a Masters in Education in 1997. After several years of teaching, Boinamo joined the DA in 2003 and became an MP in 2004 where he served as spokeperson on education. He was re-elected to parliament in 2009. Source: DA (http://www.da.org.za)

persons.biography: Deputy Minister Oosthuizen was born on 10 May 1957. He became the Deputy Minister of Sport and Recreation in 2004. Mr Oosthuizen was a member of the South African Air Force up to the Rank of Captain from 1980 until 1983 and then became self employed from 1984 to 1987. A true “Nat”, he became a Member of Parliament in 1987. The Deputy Minister holds a Bachelor of Arts degree in Political Science from Rand Afrikaans University (RAU); a Bachelor of Arts Honours degree in Development Studies from RAU, Suma Cum Laude and various other courses and study tours. Between the years 2001 and 2004, he served as an ANC Member in the Defence and Correctional Services Portfolio Committees. Source: (info.gov.za)

persons.biography: Ms. Borman was an MP from 1999-2004. She was a member of the Provincial and Local Portfolio Committee, the Social Development Portfolio Committee and the Public Enterprises Portfolio Committee among others. Ms. Borman joined the ANC in 2005 and won the ward for the ANC from DA and served as ward councilor from 2006-2009. She has taken courses in matrix exemption and bookkeeping. Currently Ms. Borman is a member of the PC on Human Settlement. Source: ANC (www.anc.org.za)

persons.summary: Mr Gardee has been involved in politics since 1985. He became part of the ANC in Botswana when he was exiled from South Africa for being involved in student uprisings. Mr Gardee has a Higher National Diploma in Accounting and Auditing. When he returned to SA, he worked for the ANC before joining the EFF. Gardee is the Commissar responsible for Mobilisation, Campaigns and Special Projects of the Economic Freedom Fighters.

persons.biography: Ms Tseke has served as a Member of the Portfolio Committees on Transportation and PC Women, Youth, Children and People with Disability. Prior to serving as an MP, she served as an ANC Ward Councilor (2000 – 2005); Maretele PCO Administrator (2004 – 2009); ANC Greenmara Branch Secretary (2001 – 2004); Deputy Branch Secretary (200-6 – 2008); and ANC WL branch Chairperson (2001 – 2002). She has received a University Diploma in Education (1995 – 1997); Diploma in Business Computing (2004); and a Certificate in Managing the Employment Process (2006). (Source: anc.org.za)

persons.biography: Minister Pandor was born on 07 December 1953. She holds two Masters degrees in Education (University of London), and Linguistics (University of Stellenbosch). She had been a Member of Parliament since 1994, during which time she served as caucus whip; Chairperson of the NCOP, and as well as Member of the Portfolio Committee on Education. Minister Pandor taught at such distinguished institutions as Ernest Bevin School, Taung College of Education, University of Bophuthatswana, and the University of Cape Town. In the mid to late 90s, she served as both the Deputy Chairperson and Chairperson of the Tertiary Education Fund of South Africa (TEFSA). She was Minister of Science and Technology in the previous administration. Source: (gov.za)

He became a Presiding Officer for the Whips Committee Member of Executive Committee, a Deputy Chairperson of the Committee of Chairpersons, the Chairperson of Budget and Oversight Committee, Chairperson of the NCOP Business Committee, a Chairperson of the Review of Rules Committee, a Member of the Rules Committee and a Member of the Programming Committee. persons.biography: Deputy Minister Magwanishe has served a Member of Parliament since 1999. He holds Master of Business Administration (MBA) from the regent Business School in 2006; a Bachelor of Science in Jurisprudence degree in 2001 and a Certificate on Strategic Leadership Programme from the WITS Business School in 2003. He has also served as Whip in various committees and as Cluster Whip for Justice and Constitutional Development; Defence; Home Affairs; Foreign Affairs; Safety and Security; Correctional Services and Intelligence from 2004 to 2009 and as Deputy Chief Whip of the Ruling Party in the National Assembly from October 2008 until his re-deployment as a Deputy Minister. He was born in 1973. Source: (info.gov.za)

persons.biography:
Dr Gregory Allen Grootboom was elected as an MPL in April 2009. He served on various portfolio committees within the DA in the Northern Cape. He was the Shadow MEC for Education in the Northern Cape. He also served on the portfolio committees for Sport, Arts and Culture as well as Roads and Public Works. Prior to entering politics full time, Dr Grootbooom practiced as a psychologist where he was Managing Director of Kim Care Centre (Private Psychology Practice).He holds a PhD from the University of the Free State in South Africa. source: [dancp.co.za](http://www.dancp.co.za/index.php/menuourpeople/membersofprovinciallegislature "bio").
Dr Grootboom is the shadow Deputy Minister for Arts and Culture.

During 2006 he was a visiting scholar to the University of California in Los Angeles through the prestigious international Ford Scholarship. He has also published an ensemble of poetry and a second ensemble is currently in print. source: [bookstore.xlibris.com](http://bookstore.xlibris.com/Products/SKU-0303141049/Taking-the-Face-Off.aspx "bio").

persons.biography: Gregory completed his post-secondary education at the University of Cape Town where he attained a BCom degree.  In 1998 he was appointed as the Executive Director of the Democratic Party of which his main responsibility was that of managing the party’s 1999 General Election Campaign. He was first elected to Parliament in 1999 as a representative of Mpumalanga and KwaZulu-Natal in 2004. Gregory is presently serving his third term as the Provincial Chairperson of KZN, consultant to the CEO in respect of election matters and Shadow Minister of Economic Development for DA. Source: DA (www.da.org.za)

persons.biography: Minister Nkwinti was born on 18 December 1948. He holds a Masters degree in Public Policy and Management from the University of London and a Bachelor of Administration degree specialising in Political Science, Public Administration and Applied Economics from the University of South Africa. Prior to his appointment as a Minister he was Speaker of the EC Provincial Legislature from the 1994 to 1999; MEC for Housing 1999 to 2005; and MEC for Agriculture EC from 2005 to 2009. Source: (gov.za)

persons.biography: Mr Magama has had an active, dynamic, and often rewarding experience in politics. Highlights of his career include: Deputy Chairperson of SAYCO (1987-90), Co-ordinator of the RELEASE MANDELA Campaign (1988-89), Chairperson of the Cosas Upington Region (1990-91), Provincial Education Secretary Cosas, Northern Cape (1990-1992) and Regional Secretary of the ANC Siyanda region (1997-1998). Mr Magama also authored the paper Perspectives & Analyses (2006).

Helen was born in the Eastern Cape and obtained a teaching diploma from Zonnebloem College in Cape Town and completed diplomas in business management and advanced bookkeeping.  She first entered the political arena in 1992 after joining the DP.  In 2000 she was appointed as s regional organiser for the DA and was subsequently promoted to Acting Director of the DA in the Western Region.  She was first elected to Parliament in 2004 in the capacity of member of the National Council of Provinces.  Prior to her current position of Shadow Minister for Women, Children and People with Disabilities, she was Shadow Minister of Social Development of the DA. Source: DA (www.da.org.za).

Dr van Schalkwyk was born and raised in the Eastern Cape. After completing her high school career she furthered her studies at Stellenbosch University and graduated with a BA degree. She obtained her PhD in Biblical Science from the University of South Africa in 2003. She has extensive teaching experience and first became involved in South African politics in 2006. On her entry to politics Dr van Schalkwyk was elected as a councilor of the Hantam Municipality and served as the vice chairperson in the Hantam-Hoogland constituency from 2006 to 2007.  She is currently appointed as the Shadow Deputy Minister of Arts and Culture and also serving as the vice chairperson of the DA’s local branch in Calvinia. Source: DA (http://www.da.org.za).

persons.biography: Deputy Minister Bogopane-Zulu had been a Member of Parliament since 1999. She served both the South African Federation of Disabled People and the South Africa National AIDS Council since 1994 and 2000 respectively. She had served both Parliament and Government in various portfolios, and such institutions as the National Economic Development and Labour Council (Nedlac); South African Qualification Authority (SAQA); Disabled Children's Action Group;; and the World Blind Union. Prior to her appointment as Deputy Minister of Women, Children and Persons with Disability, she served as a Deputy Minister of Public Works. She holds BTech Degree. Source: (info.gov.za)

Hendrik was born in Klerksdorp. Upon completing his secondary education, Mr Schmidt studies law. He completed a B.Luris and an LLB degree from UNISA, an LLM from RAU and an MPhil. Mr Schmidt has extensive experience in the South African justice system, as he worked for the Department of Justice as a public prosecutor and then as a State advocate, and later as Senior State Advocate. He started his political career working as councilor in 1999 and was first elected to Parliament in 1999. He was appointed as the DA’s spokesperson for Minerals and Energy from 2004 to 2009. Hendrik is currently appointed as the Shadow Deputy Minister of Mineral Resources for the DA. Source: DA (http://www.da.org.za).

persons.biography: Deputy Minister Mkhize was born on 06 September 1952. She served as a Member of Parliament since 2009. A founding member, and trustee, of the Children and Violence Trust since 1995, had been a trustee of the Malibongwe Business Trust from 2005. Professor Mkhize holds a BA degree in Psychology, Social Work and Sociology (University of Zululand); BA Hons (Psychology) and a Masters in Clinical Psychology from the University of Natal. She was a senior lecturer and researcher at Wits from 1990 until 1995. She was a board member of the South African Prisoner's Organisation for Human Rights from 1994 to 1995; Truth and Reconciliation Commission (TRC) Commissioner and Chairperson of the Reparations and Rehabilitation committee from 1995 to 2003. Prior to her appointment, Prof Mkhize was ambassador to the Netherlands, and had a short stint as Deputy Minister for Correctional Services. Source: (info.gov.za)

persons.biography: An MP since 2004, Mr. Maluleka has maintained an optimistic view of South Africa’s future, affirming that he is “confident” of the country’s’ future and believes it will continue to “improve.” He has earned both a Local Government and Administration Certificate (UNISA), along with a Democracy and Local Goverance certificate (Univ. of Stockholm). Mr Maluleka has served as the Speaker of the Tshwane Municipality, Executive Chairperson of the Greater Pretoria Municipality, and the Mamelodi Civic Organisation Deputy Chairperson.

persons.summary:
Mr Ollis was born in East London in 1970. He completed his tertiary education through the Baptist Theological College, University of Zululand and attained a Master of Arts degree from WITS University. Prior to joining South African politics, Mr Ollis worked in the higher education sector. He joined the Democratic Party (DP) in 1999 and was elected to the City Council in 2005. In 2006 he was re-elected as a ward councilor and has worked for the DA’s fundraising department and executed duties on the Gauteng South Regional Executive. He was first elected to Parliament in 2009 and is currently serving as the DA’ Shadow Minister of Transport. Source: DA (www.da.org.za).

persons.biography: Mr Mthembu was born in 1958 in Mpumalanga. During the 1976 Soweto uprising, he was a student leader at Elukhanyisweni Secondary School in Witbank. As a student he was often kicked out of school for not affording his school fees, uniform and books. He went to the University of Fort Hare but was later expelled, and started working at Highveld Steel as a training officer. During the state of emergency in the 1980s he was in and out of prison. Mr Mthembu was charged with trea¬son and acquitted between 1986 and 1988.  He led the Swapo support group in 300 taxis to the first democratic elections in 1988 in Namibia. He was a MEC in Mpumalanga for Public Roads and Transport.  He chaired the Portfolio Committees on Local Government, Educa¬tion, Sport and Recreation, and Arts and Culture, an ANC Chief Whip. Source: (sahistory.org.za)

Mr Lorimer was born in Johannesburg in 1962. He completed a BA degree at the University of the Witswatersrand and worked as a freelance journalist whilst studying. He worked as a news anchor on radio 702 in 1994 and started Network Radio Services in the same year, executing duties as its Chief Executive Officer. He became involved in politics in 2003 after being appointed as Tony Leon’s Media Director. He was subsequently promoted to the national media team fulfilling the role of Media and Research Director for the DA caucus in the Gauteng Legislature. James is currently appointed as the DA’s Shadow Minister of Mineral Resources. Source: DA (http://www.da.org.za)

persons.biography:
James was born in Pretoria and attended Bishops boarding School in Cape Town. Upon completing his secondary education he was called up for military training in the South African National Defence Force anti-aircraft division and progressed to the rank of Lieutenant Colonel. James started his political career in late 1978 by working in the research department of the Progressive Federal Party (PFP). He became the party’s Director of Communication in 1988. He joined the Democratic Party in 1992 in the capacity of Executive Director. After his election to Parliament in 1999 he became the party’s spokesperson on Provincial and Local Government. In 2004 he was re-elected to Parliament and became responsible for the Correctional Services Portfolio. He assumed his current post of Shadow Minister of Correctional Services upon his re-election to Parliament in 2009. (http://www.da.org.za).

Mr Selfe remains as one of the DA's shadow Minister for Justice and Correctional Services, as of June 2014

persons.biography:
Mr James Vos served as chairman of the council’s rules portfolio committee where he was part of a team responsible for drafting the first rules of order for the new Unicity council and Sub-councils as in Cape Town since the formation of the Unicity in 2000. 
With the appointment of the shadow cabinet in Parliament, James was appointed as the DA’s Minister of Tourism – a portfolio that has the capacity to create various types of employment opportunities on a large scale. 
In Council, Mr Vos was in charge of the Tourism component of the portfolio committee and also officiated as spokesperson. He was responsible for driving legislation and policies aimed at the tourism sector, and establishing networks within the industry.

persons.biography: Minister Radebe was born on 18 February 1953. He holds a B.Juris degree from the University of Zululand; LLM in International Law from Leipzig University. He had served the ANC as Policy Unit head, a position he continues to hold. But had been member of the NEC – ANC’s decision making structure in between conferences - since 1991. He underwent military training with Umkhonto weSizwe (MK), and was once arrested and convicted under the Terrorism Act. He served as Minister of Public Works, Public Enterprises, and Transport prior to his appointment as Minister of Justice and Constitutional Development. Source: (gov.za)

persons.biography: Deputy Minister Cronin was born on 12 September 1949. He currently is the Deputy General-Secretary of South African Communist Party (SACP), a position he has held since 1995. He became a Member of Parliament since 1999. His illustrious political career dates back into time, such that he Co-Convened the Reconstruction and Development Programme Drafting Committee and was a member of the negotiating Team at Convention for a Democratic South Africa (CODESA). The Deputy Minister lectured at UCT between 1973 and 1976; but also was Editor of the African Communist Magazine. Prior to his current appoint, he was Deputy Minister for Transport. Source: (info.gov.za)

He has been an activist, exile and political prisoner, the latter of which inspired his personal memoirs published in Robben Island manuals. Mr Maake has been a member of the Portfolio Committee on Trade and Industry and has served as the Premier Director of Strategic Planning at the Office of Limpopo.

persons.biography: Mr Thibedi has served on the Executive Council of the North West Provincial Government. He was the MEC for Public Works before becoming a Member of Parliament. He was a political activist and is considered a revolutionary who was at the forefront of the people’s struggle for liberation during Apartheid. He holds a Masters degree in Governance and Political Transformation from the University of the Free State, as well as two Diplomas in Executive Management and Transformation from Harvard University.

persons.biography: Ms Fubbs was born on 30 November 1944. She received her BA Honours in clinical psychology from the University of South Africa (UNISA) in 1990, her Msc in Development in 1993 from the University of Witwatersrand, and a postgraduate degree in Economic Principles from London University in 2012. An MP since 2004, she has served as the Whip of the Joint Budget Committee (NA and NCOP), the Whip of the Economic Transformation Cluster and a Member of the Portfolio Committee on Finance. Ms Fubbs also chaired the Standing Committee on Finance and Economic Affairs and was the Deputy Chair of the Internal Audit in the Gauteng Legislature. She has served as the Chairperson of the Portfolio Committee on Trade and Industry since 2004.

persons.biography: Minister “Sbu” Ndebele was born on 17 October 1948. The current Chancellor of the University of Zululand (UniZulu), studied Library Science at UniZulu; Bachelor of Arts degree in International Politics and African Politics from Unisa. He was arrested for ANC activities in May 1976 and was sentenced to ten years on Robben Island in June 1977. He played a key role in peace initiatives in Natal during the late 80s. He served as MEC for Transport in KwaZulu-Natal in 1994-2004; and was a member of the KwaZulu-Natal Provincial Executive Committee and the Provincial Working Committee of the ANC from 1994 to 2008. Source: (info.gov.za)

Mr Gelderblom has served on various parliamentary committees for the ANC.  He was elected as the Chairperson of the Standing Committee on Community Safety & Economic Affairs. From 2001 to 2004 he served as an MEC for Agriculture and Tourism, and Environmental Affairs. In 2004 he was appointed as the Chairperson of the Standing Committee on Public Accounts (SCOPA), and as the Chairperson on Social Development and Heath from 2007 to 2009. Mr Gelderblom completed his tertiary education at the University of Stellenbosch where he obtained a BA Honours degree in 1975. He has served as a Member of Parliament on the Portfolio Committee on Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries.

persons.biography: Ms Johanna Mmule Maluleke currently serves as the ANC Whip in the Water and Sanitation Portfolio Committee, as of June 2014. She formerly served as Mathibestad ANC Branch Secretary from 1996-2000, following that she became Ward 12 Branch Secretary from 2000-2003.She was also the Riverside SANCO Branch Secretary from 1994-2004. She progressed to become Ward 12 Branch Chairperson in the period from 2003-2006 in William Modiba. Ms Maluleke was also once, the Ward 18 Branch Secretary and a Bojanala Regional Executive Council (REC) Member. She read for a National Certificate in Local Economic Development and completed a Basic Computer training course. In the National Assembly she has served on the Portfolio Committee on Public Service and Administration. souce: [anc.org.za](http://www.anc.org.za/caucus/get_mp.php?q=450 "bio")

persons.biography: Mr De Lange was born on 15 January 1958. He obtained his BA in Law from the University of Stellenbosch (1978) and his LLB from University of Cape Town (1983). Mr De Lange was the former Deputy Minister for Justice and Constitutional Development (2004-09), was the Head of the Office of Criminal Justice Review (2006-09) and was Commissioner on the Judicial Service Commission (1996-04). He is currently a member of the Subcommittee on Social Transformation and the Subcommittee on Economic Transformation.

persons.biography: Mr Joseph Job McGluwa grew up in the Alabama suburb of Klerksdorp  (Matlosane) .He matriculated at Alabama Senior Secondary School and obtained a Certificate in Governance and Public Leadership from UNISA. He also read for an Advance Certificate in Public Administration and Leadership(WITS).He currently is reading for a Post Graduate Diploma in Management at the same institution.He is the Shadow Minister and Spoke person for Public Service and Administration. Mr McGluwa is the Constituency Head of Mahikeng, Tswaiing and Ratlou. He is a  Federal Council member and the Deputy Leader in the North West for the DA
persons.name: Joseph Job McGluwa
persons.summary:
Mr Joseph Job McGluwa grew up in the Alabama suburb of Klerksdorp  (Matlosane) .He matriculated at Alabama Senior Secondary School and obtained a Certificate in Governance and Public Leadership from UNISA. He also read for an Advance Certificate in Public Administration and Leadership(WITS).He currently is reading for a Post Graduate Diploma in Management at the same institution.He is the Shadow Minister and Spoke person for Public Service and Administration. Mr McGluwa is the Constituency Head of Mahikeng, Tswaiing and Ratlou. He is a  Federal Council member and the Deputy Leader in the North West for the DA.
Mr McGluwa was with the Independent Democrats since its inception. He is currently a Member of Parliament in the National Assembly and has served on the Portfolio Committees for Sport and Recreation, Home Affairs, and Housing. Mr McGluwa was also the National organiser of the Independent Democrats, and has overseen the rapid growth of the party by setting up constituency offices countrywide.

persons.name: Junita Carolina Kloppers-Lourens
persons.summary:
Junita Carolina Kloppers-Lourens's plenary attendance record for Feb-Apr[2013](/file_archive/Junita-Carolina-Kloppers-Lourens-Attendance-2013 "Junita Carolina Kloppers-Lourens") and [2012](/file_archive/Junita-Carolina-Kloppers-Lourens-Attendance-2013 "Junita Carolina Kloppers-Lourens").

Dr Kloppers-Lourens joined the DA in 2005 and was elected to Parliament in 2009. She was born in and raised in Vanderbijlpark in Gauteng. After completing her secondary education she continued her studies at the University of Pretoria where she completed a BA and Honors degree in History. In addition to this, she completed a Master’s and Doctorate degree in Education at RAU, a LLB at UNISA and the AIPSA Diploma for Insolvency Practitioners at the University of Pretoria. She was previously employed as a chief researcher and developer to the Bureau for Curriculum Development and Evaluation, Public Relations Officer for Perskor Publishers and later Academic Publisher for Lex Patria Publishers. She is currently serving as the Shadow Minister of Science and Technology for the DA. Source: DA (http://www.da.org.za)
